intro: Oreocome limprichtii, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cool, humid environments. Its compact growth habit and ability to withstand harsh mountain conditions make it a resilient species. Oreocome limprichtii is often found in cloud forests and alpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
